name: CQFMArtifactAssessment
title: CQFM Artifact Assessment
description: This Extension provides one or more comments, classifiers or ratings about an Artifact and supports attribution and rights management metadata for the added content.

element.short: Additional documentation, review, or usage guidance
element.definition: A comment containing additional documentation, a review comment, usage guidance, or other relevant information from a particular user.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html) for a list).

element.short: What the comment is directed to
element.definition: A URI that points to what the comment is about, such as a line of text in the CQL, or a specific element in a resource.
element.comment: The target element is used to point the comment to aspect of the artifact, typically a text range within a CQL library (e.g. Library/example#content?0:0-120:80).

element.definition: Provides additional supporting information relevant to the comment.
element.comment: The reference element is used to reference other relevant information. For example, a comment may point to a citation in a relatedArtifact element (e.g. Library/example#relatedArtifact[ABC]).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Additional documentation, review, or usage guidance
element.definition: A comment containing additional documentation, a review comment, usage guidance, or other relevant information from a particular user.
Indicates whether the comment is  providing additional documentation, a review comment that requires resolution, or providing usage guidance to an artifact consumer.

binding.description: The type of artifact comment (documentation, review, guidance)

element.definition: The text content of the comment.

element.short: What the comment is directed to
element.definition: A URI that points to what the comment is about, such as a line of text in the CQL, or a specific element in a resource.
element.comment: The target element is used to point the comment to aspect of the artifact, typically a text range within a CQL library (e.g. Library/example#content?0:0-120:80).

element.definition: Provides additional supporting information relevant to the comment.
element.comment: The reference element is used to reference other relevant information. For example, a comment may point to a citation in a relatedArtifact element (e.g. Library/example#relatedArtifact[ABC]).

element.definition: Specifies the user that authored the comment.
